text:
Hi guys, I'm buddy Oliver and today I'm
gonna show you how to fillet a fish

This is the beautiful mackerel and I'm
going to show you how to take the

fillets off. First thing we need to do is
clean the mackerel, we've taken the guts out

of this mackerel so it's nice and clean
inside. Most people think that filleting

fish is scary, but my Dad taught me a way
to make it really easy. What you need to

do is to be prepared, I've got a tray to
put in my finished fillet

I've got a bowl to put in all of my
bad bits, I've got these pliers to take

the bones out, this is a knife sharpener
and this is a bendy knife to go around

all the bones. This is quite tricky but I
practice loads of time so you should

probably do it with an adult. First thing
you want to do is good your knife a

quick sharpen, then we're going to cut the
off. We're gonna to go behind the fin and

cut through and place this here.
This is a spine, you're going to cut down
either side of it

and you're gonna stop at about this line.
You're gonna clean your knife and be

really careful when you're moving your
fish around. The anus is here... The anus

is here, we're going to cut through to it
and then when you've got it, in you're

gonna bend your knife and cut down, then,
with your blade, you're gonna use the

middle of your knife and do gentle
strokes to cut your face off

Be very gentle with this part and there
we have one fillet and we haven't got

too much waste on their, only a little
bit. Now we will tidy up the fillet

We're gonna pop our fish here, we're
gonna tidy up the tail, we're gonna get

the end of the fillet here and use the
tip of your knife and put two fingers on

top of it and really hardly take that
off, if it doesn't work try and follow
your line and do that

Now we're gonna gently put our fillet
 in the middle of the board, get

a cloth and have a wipe down. So now we
need these pliers take the bones out, you

can use pliers from your Dad's shed, but
give them a good clean. We're gonna run

our finger down the middle of the fillet
and we're gonna use our pliers to pull

the bone out. My sister doesn't like the
bones, so I'm gonna take all of them

out. As you get closer to the tail you
won't have many bones

There you go last one, now we're gonna
turn our fillet over then you're gonna get

rid of these bones. We're going to use
our cloth to get rid of the bones

We're going to pinch the fish and we're
going to put some lines in it

Be really gentle, you don't want to do
it too deep. We're doing it so we can put

seasoning and herbs, it'll cook faster
and yeah that's what they're for. I'm gonna

let the knife do all the work and
that's my first fillet. Now we're going
to crack on with the other side

Haven't done much waste there, we're
gonna pop it in the middle of our pan. Now

you're gonna clean up our fish. Take our
tail off, now we're going to take the

bones out. There we go, last bone out and
there we go, that's my filleted mackerel

So it's a bit tricky, but give it a go
and don't be scared of it. I'm gonna cook

this a bit later on because my family
loved it. If you want instructions to

how to do this, click the link below.
See you guys!
